Description: An introduction to the intellectual enterprises of computer science and the art of programming.
Subject: Programming

Course Title: CS50's Introduction to Programming with Scratch
Description: A gentle introduction to programming that prepares you for subsequent courses in coding.
Subject: Computer Science

Course Title: CS50's Introduction to Programming with Python
Description: An introduction to programming using Python, a popular language for general-purpose programming, data science, web programming, and more.
Subject: Programming

Course Title: CS50's Web Programming with Python and JavaScript
Description: This course picks up where CS50 leaves off, diving more deeply into the design and implementation of web apps with Python, JavaScript, and SQL using frameworks like Django, React, and Bootstrap.
Subject: Programming

Description: This course is a variant of Harvard University's introduction to computer science, CS50, designed especially for lawyers (and law students).
Subject: Computer Science

Course Title: CS50's Introduction to Artificial Intelligence with Python
Description: Learn to use machine learning in Python in this introductory course on artificial intelligence.
Subject: Computer Science

Description: Learn how to protect your own data, devices, and systems from today's threats.
Subject: Computer Science

Course Title: CS50's Introduction to Databases with SQL
Description: Learn how to create, read, update, and delete data with relational databases.
Subject: Computer Science

Description: Focusing on the basics of machine learning and embedded systems, such as smartphones, this course will introduce you to the “language” of TinyML.
Subject: Computer Science

Description: Get the opportunity to see TinyML in practice. You will see examples of TinyML applications, and learn first-hand how to train these models for tiny applications such as keyword spotting, visual wake words, and gesture recognition.
Subject: Computer Science

Description: Learn to program in TensorFlow Lite for microcontrollers so that you can write the code, and deploy your model to your very own tiny microcontroller. Before you know it, you’ll be implementing an entire TinyML application.
Subject: Computer Science

Description: Gain a deep understanding of the legal ramifications of clients’ technological decisions and policies.
Subject: Social Sciences

Description: Take your introductory knowledge of Python programming to the next level and learn how to use Python 3 for your research.
Subject: Computer Science

Description: Build a movie recommendation system and learn the science behind one of the most popular and successful data science techniques.
Subject: Computer Science

Description: This course from Harvard Business School (HBS) Online will teach you how to compete in the age of AI.
